definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: In 1946, in Oxford, England, two young men officially started Mensa.
sentences.chinese: 1946年，兩個年輕人在英國牛津正式創辦門薩。

sentences.english: The social side of Mensa is the primary draw.
sentences.chinese: 門薩最主要的吸引力來自社會層面。

sentences.english: In some cases, however, Mensa will accept verified IQ test results from tests other than their own.
sentences.chinese: 不過有時候，門薩也會接受其他有效智商考試的成績。

sentences.english: Most large cities have branches or chapters of Mensa.
sentences.chinese: 絕大多數大城市裏都有門薩的分支機構或分會。

sentences.english: When it comes to IQ tests, Mensa is the king.
sentences.chinese: 說到智商測驗，門薩無疑是個中翹楚。

sentences.english: The UK chapter of Mensa says Elise is the youngest ever member.
sentences.chinese: 英國篇門薩稱埃莉斯是有史以來年紀最年幼的會員。
